intro: Erythrocephalum decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive redhead, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant produces bright red to orange flower heads, which are often mistaken for other species due to their striking appearance. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils. Erythrocephalum decipiens is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
